title: CED: Catalog Extraction from Documents. (arXiv:2304.14662v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Sentence-by-sentence information extraction from long documents is an exhausting and error-prone task. As the indicator of document skeleton, catalogs naturally chunk documents into segments and provide informative cascade semantics, which can help to reduce the search space. Despite their usefulness, catalogs are hard to be extracted without the assist from external knowledge. For documents that adhere to a specific template, regular expressions are practical to extract catalogs. However, handcrafted heuristics are not applicable when processing documents from different sources with diverse formats. To address this problem, we build a large manually annotated corpus, which is the first dataset for the Catalog Extraction from Documents (CED) task. tldr: 该论文提出一种目录从文档中提取（CED）的新任务，通过构建大规模的手动注释语料库并提出一个基于转换的框架来解决这个问题。实验结果表明，该方法优于基准系统并具有良好的迁移能力。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new task of Catalog Extraction from Documents (CED) and solves the problem by building a large manually annotated corpus and proposing a transition-based framework. Experimental results show that the proposed method outperforms baseline systems and has good transferability.
